page.title: 18TRANSPORT
page.content: {BUS. }A bus service, operating six days a week, links Newquay with Padstow via Harlyn. A single bus each day goes from Harlyn to Bodmin Parkway (main line) Station, and return. There is no other rail or road transport. {PADSTOW LIFEBOAT of the RNLI.}The Boat house (completed 1967) is reached by 126 steps on the E side of Trevose Head. The access road is private and locked. Launching is a spectacular operation, via a steep 240ft. slipway. The lifeboat, the 'James Burrough' is of Tyne Class, a new 18 knot slipway launching type. Under its now-famous coxswain, Trevor England, the station has a proud history of sea rescues and was involved in the Fastnet Race rescues in 1979. Between Jan. and Sept. 1985, the Padstow Lifeboat was emgaged in 12 rescue missions.
